snippet: Mark Nilsson, 25, is an artist in the prime of his starving period, starving for paying customers willing to sit for $50 portraits that are nothing like the sugary caricatures you get in Times Square.
abstract: Corey Killgannon Character Study column on Mark Nilsson, artist who makes his living by painting $50 portraits outside the doors of the Museum of Modern Art.
lead_paragraph: Mark Nilsson, 25, is an artist in the prime of his starving period, starving for paying customers willing to sit for $50 portraits that are nothing like the sugary caricatures you get in Times Square.

headline.print_headline: The Starving Artist at MoMA’s Doors
headline.seo: Mark Nilsson, the Starving Artist Outside MoMA’s Doors
headline.main: The Starving Artist at MoMA’s Doors
